result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul A. CANNON

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

Defendant in custody.
State moves to dismiss and read in.  Defendant plead to a similar charge in case no: 15 CM 63.  Motion granted.
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.

Defendant in custody.
Attorney Griesbach advised the Court that the defendant will be reapplying for the public defender.  Defendant still wants an attorney.
Plea date reset for 11-23-15 at 10:30 a.m.
Minutes.
to JLF from Victim Witness with victim impact statement of Amber Rodgers.

Defendant in custody.
Attorney Lambrecht withdrew as counsel in these matters.
The defendant will be reapplying at the public defender's office tomorrow.
Plea date is reset to 11-05-15 at 3:00 p.m.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on warrant.  The matter is continued for a plea date on 10-21-15 at 1:30  p.m., Br. 3.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash.  Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.  Copy filed.
Original Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

Motion and Order to Withdraw as Counsel.
Cover letter.

ADDRESS INFO for Paul A. CANNON
Current: 908 Washington Street, Room 112, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 02-26-2015)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220
$50.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
RE:  Violate domestic abuse injunction, on 02-21-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of violate domestic abuse injunction and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50.00 cash with the condition that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
